title: Supreme Court Hears FBI Claim of State Secrets in Muslim Surveillance Case
sub_head: FBI sent a bodybuilder into mosque to look for would-be terrorists; they turned him in to the FBI
body:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court appeared divided at arguments on Monday over whether Muslim Americans who allege the FBI targeted them in 2006 because of their religion can proceed with a lawsuit that the government argues must be dismissed to protect state secrets.
The investigation itself, where the government sent a bodybuilder to infiltrate an Irvine, Calif., mosque in search of potential terrorists, isn’t a secret. Code-named Operation Flex, the investigation was disclosed in litigation years ago and became the subject of a 2012 public-radio documentary.
